Key Arguments: The bill undermines the ability of Australians to discern truth from falsehood themselves.
It resembles governance structures of dictatorships or totalitarian regimes, not a democracy.
The bill threatens freedom of speech, which is protected by the Australian constitution.
Public debate and scrutiny should be the means to combat misinformation, not government intervention.
The bill represents an overreach of government power and could lead to further censorship.
Notable Quotes: A nation of people that is without the ability to speak or to debate ideas publicly is by very definition not free but enslaved.
If power is granted to this proposed bill, where will this power end?
The atrocities that regime went on to perpetrate haunt the world to this day.
